gov.usgs.earthquake.nshmp.calc

Class CalcConfig.Hazard

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.earthquake.nshmp.calc.CalcConfig.Hazard
  • Enclosing class:
    CalcConfig

    public static final class CalcConfig.Hazard
extends Object
    Hazard calculation configuration.

    • Field Detail

      • exceedanceModel

        public final ExceedanceModel exceedanceModel
        The probability distribution model to use when computing hazard curves.

        Default: ExceedanceModel.TRUNCATION_UPPER_ONLY

      • truncationLevel

        public final double truncationLevel
        The number of standard deviations (σ) at which to truncate a distribution. This field is ignored if an ExceedanceModel does not implement truncation.

        Default: 3.0

      • imts

        public final Set<Imt> imts
        The Set of IMTs for which calculations should be performed.

        Default: [Imt.PGA, Imt.SA0P2, Imt.SA1P0 ]

      • gmmPostProcessors

        public final List<GmmPostProcessor.Model> gmmPostProcessors
        The post processors used to adjust ground motions derived from GroundMotionModels (GMMs). The models may apply corrections or scale factors to GMM-derived μ- and σ-values. For example, see RezaeianDamping_2014. If multiple post processors are specified, they are executed in the order listed.

        Default: [ (empty) ]

      • gmmDampingRatio

        public final double gmmDampingRatio
        Viscous damping ratio. The default value is consistent with that used in GroundMotionModel most (GMM) development. Values other than 5% will apply a damping scale factor (DSF) to adjust the 5% damped spectral ordinates predicted by GMMs.

        Default: 5.0%
        Range: 0.5% to 30.0%

        Note: At this time, the damping scaling factor (DSF) model (Rezaeian et al., 2014) is only applicable to active continental crust GMMs and will not be applied to ground motion values from GMMs for other tectonic regions.

        See Also:
        RezaeianDamping_2014

      • gmmDampingSigma

        public final boolean gmmDampingSigma
        Whether or not GroundMotionModel (GMM) sigmas are also modified according to the Rezaeian et al. (2014) model when applying damping scaling factors (DSF).

      • gmmUncertainty

        public final boolean gmmUncertainty
        Whether to consider additional ground motion model uncertainty, or not. Currently this is only applicable when using the PEER NGA-West or NGA-West2 Gmms with USGS hazard models.

        Default: false

      • valueFormat

        public final ValueFormat valueFormat
        The value format for hazard curves.

        Default: ValueFormat.ANNUAL_RATE

    • Method Detail

      • modelCurve

        public XySequence modelCurve(Imt imt)
        An empty linear curve for the requested Imt.
        Parameters:
        imt - to get curve for
        See Also:
        defaults

      • modelCurves

        public Map<Imt,XySequence> modelCurves()
        An immutable map of model curves where x-values are in linear space. In the absence of specific values being provided in a config file, the following defaults are used:

        PGA and SA: [0.0025, 0.0045, 0.0075, 0.0113, 0.0169, 0.0253, 0.0380, 0.0570, 0.0854, 0.128, 0.192, 0.288, 0.432, 0.649, 0.973, 1.46, 2.19, 3.28, 4.92, 7.38]

        PGV: [0.0100, 0.0177, 0.0312, 0.0552, 0.0976, 0.173, 0.305, 0.539, 0.953, 1.68, 2.98, 5.26, 9.30, 16.4, 29.1, 51.3, 90.8, 160, 284, 501]

      • logModelCurves

        public Map<Imt,XySequence> logModelCurves()
        An immutable map of model curves where x-values are in natural-log space.
        See Also:
        linear space defaults
